elements.title: aiming stone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Beşiktaş aiming stone in Istanbul (pictured) marks the spot where in 1810 Sultan Mahmud II hit an ostrich egg 735.9 metres (2,414 ft) away?

elements.title: killing baby Hitler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ethical dilemma of killing baby Hitler has been compared to the trolley problem?

elements.title: Nancy Ross (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that just seven years after being elected to a local school board, Nancy Ross was a candidate for Vice President of the United States?

elements.title: Ellhorn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Liechtenstein ceded the Ellhorn mountain to Switzerland in 1949?

elements.title: Wolvesey Palace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 17th-century Wolvesey Palace reuses a 15th-century chapel built on the remains of a 12th-century room from Wolvesey Castle?

elements.title: Rapa Nui lizardfish (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite commonly being caught with a hook and line, the holotype of the Rapa Nui lizardfish was instead collected with a spear?

elements.title: Buellia aethalea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Buellia aethalea, a species of fungus, is also known as the "darkened button lichen" due to the small black spots on its crusty grey surface?

elements.title: a bill that would potentially ban the app (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that TikTok rallied its users to protest a bill that would potentially ban the app?

elements.title: Jack White (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jack White worked for the New York Yankees – and for the New York Yankees?
